VBottomSheet/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VBottomSheet/inset.description: Reduces the sheet content maximum width to 70%.

VBottomSheet/scrollable.description: When set to true, expects a `v-card` and a `v-card-text` component with a designated height. For more information, check out the [scrollable example](/components/dialogs#scrollable).

VBottomSheet/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

VBottomSheet/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`. (Note: The parent element must have position: relative.).

VBottomSheet/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

VBottomSheet/content-props.description: Apply custom properties to the content.

VBottomSheet/opacity.description: Sets the opacity of the scrim element. Only applies if `scrim` is enabled.

VBottomSheet/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of the content element when using the persistent prop.

VBottomSheet/persistent.description: Clicking outside of the element or pressing esc key will not deactivate it.

VBottomSheet/scrim.description: Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

VBottomSheet/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component.

VBottomSheet/target.description: For locationStrategy="connected", specify an element or array of x,y coordinates that the overlay should position itself relative to. This will be the activator element by default.

VBottomSheet/activator-props.description: Apply custom properties to the activator.

VBottomSheet/open-on-click.description: Activate the component when the activator is clicked.

VBottomSheet/open-on-hover.description: Activate the component when the activator is hovered.

VBottomSheet/open-on-focus.description: Activate the component when the activator is focused.

VBottomSheet/close-on-content-click.description: Closes component when you click on its content.

VBottomSheet/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VBottomSheet/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VBottomSheet/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VBottomSheet/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator.

VBottomSheet/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VBottomSheet/offset.description: Increases distance from the target. When passed as a pair of numbers, the second value shifts anchor along the side and away from the target.

VBottomSheet/stick-to-target.description: Enables the overlay content to go off-screen when scrolling.

VBottomSheet/viewport-margin.description: Sets custom viewport margin for the overlay content

VBottomSheet/scroll-strategy.description: Strategy used when the component is activate and user scrolls.

VBottomSheet/retain-focus.description: Captures and keeps focus within the content element when using **Tab** and **Shift**+**Tab**. Recommended to be `false` when using external tools that require focus such as TinyMCE or vue-clipboard.

VBottomSheet/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element the overlay content should teleport to. Can be a direct element reference, querySelector string, or `true` to disable teleporting. Uses `body` by default.

VBreadcrumbs/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VBreadcrumbs/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VBreadcrumbs/items.description: An array of strings or objects used for automatically generating children components.

VBreadcrumbs/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VBreadcrumbs/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VBreadcrumbs/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VBreadcrumbs/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VBreadcrumbs/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VBreadcrumbs/icon.description: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component.

VBreadcrumbs/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VBreadcrumbs/divider.description: Specifies the dividing character between items.

VBreadcrumbs/active-class.description: The class applied to the component when it is in an active state.

VBreadcrumbsDivider/divider.description: Specifies the dividing character between items.

VBreadcrumbsItem/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [replace](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) prop on the vue-router documentation.

VBreadcrumbsItem/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VBreadcrumbsItem/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VBreadcrumbsItem/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VBreadcrumbsItem/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VBreadcrumbsItem/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VBreadcrumbsItem/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VBreadcrumbsItem/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VBreadcrumbsItem/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VBreadcrumbsItem/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

VBreadcrumbsItem/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

VBreadcrumbsItem/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

VBreadcrumbsItem/active-class.description: The class applied to the component when it matches the current route. Find more information about the [active-class prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the [vue-router](https://router.vuejs.org/) documentation.

VBtn/symbol.description: The [Symbol](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Symbol) used to hook into group functionality for components like [v-btn-toggle](/components/btn-toggle) and [v-bottom-navigation](/components/bottom-navigations/).

VBtn/flat.description: Removes the button box shadow. This is different than using the 'flat' variant.

VBtn/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [replace](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) prop on the vue-router documentation.

VBtn/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VBtn/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VBtn/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VBtn/size.description: Sets the height and width of the component. Default unit is px. Can also use the following predefined sizes: **x-small**, **small**, **default**, **large**, and **x-large**.

VBtn/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VBtn/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VBtn/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VBtn/location.description: Specifies the component's location. Can combine by using a space separated string.

VBtn/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VBtn/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VBtn/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VBtn/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VBtn/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VBtn/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VBtn/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VBtn/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VBtn/base-color.description: Sets the color of component when not focused.

VBtn/prepend-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

VBtn/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VBtn/block.description: Expands the button to 100% of available space.

VBtn/readonly.description: Puts the button in a readonly state. Cannot be clicked or navigated to by keyboard.

VBtn/stacked.description: Displays the button as a flex-column.

VBtn/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

VBtn/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VBtn/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VBtn/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VBtn/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VBtn/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VBtn/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VBtn/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VBtn/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

VBtn/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

VBtn/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

VBtn/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VBtn/icon.description: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component. The button will become _round_.

VBtn/spaced.description: Extends content to the edges to move main content from prepend and append slots.

VBtnGroup/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VBtnGroup/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VBtnGroup/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VBtnGroup/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VBtnGroup/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VBtnGroup/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VBtnGroup/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VBtnGroup/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VBtnGroup/base-color.description: Sets the color of component when not focused.

VBtnGroup/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VBtnToggle/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VBtnToggle/disabled.description: Puts all children components into a disabled state.

VBtnToggle/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

VBtnToggle/multiple.description: Allows one to select multiple items.

VBtnToggle/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VBtnToggle/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VBtnToggle/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VBtnToggle/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VBtnToggle/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VBtnToggle/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VBtnToggle/base-color.description: Sets the color of component when not focused.

VBtnToggle/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VBtnToggle/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VBtnToggle/mandatory.description: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).

VCalendar/type.description: A string which is one of `month`, `week`, `day`, `4day`, `custom-weekly`, `custom-daily`, and `category`. The custom types look at the `start` and `end` dates passed to the component as opposed to the `value`.

VCalendar/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VCalendar/start.description: The starting date on the calendar (inclusive) in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD`. This may be ignored depending on the `type` of the calendar.

VCalendar/end.description: The ending date on the calendar (inclusive) in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD`. This may be ignored depending on the `type` of the calendar.

VCalendar/category-days.description: The number of days to render in the `category` view.

VCalendar/categories.type:
| string
  | (string | { name: string; categoryName: string; [string]: any })[]
VCalendar/categories.description: Specifies what categories to display in the `category` view. This controls the order of the categories as well. If the calendar uses events any categories specified in those events not specified in this value are dynamically rendered in the view unless `category-hide-dynamic` is true.

VCalendar/category-text.type:
| string
  | ((
      category: string | { name: string; categoryName: string; [string]: any },
    ) => string)
VCalendar/category-text.description: If categories is a list of objects, you can use this to determine what property to print out as the category text on the calendar. You can provide a function to do some logic or just define the prop name. It's similar to item-text on v-select

VCalendar/max-days.description: The maximum number of days to display in the custom calendar if an `end` day is not set.

VCalendar/category-hide-dynamic.description: Sets whether categories specified in an event should be hidden if it's not defined in `categories`.

VCalendar/category-show-all.description: Set whether the `category` view should show all defined `categories` even if there are no events for a category.

VCalendar/category-for-invalid.description: The category to place events in that have invalid categories. A category is invalid when it is not a string. By default events without a category are not displayed until this value is specified.

VCalendar/weekdays.description: An array of weekdays to display. Does not affect the order.

VCalendar/first-day-of-week.description: Sets the first day of the week, starting with 0 for Sunday. (Note: not guaranteed to work when using custom date adapters.)

VCalendar/first-day-of-year.description: Sets the day that determines the first week of the year, starting with 0 for Sunday. For ISO 8601 this should be 4. (Note: not guaranteed to work when using custom date adapters.)

VCalendar/weekday-format.description: Formats day of the week string that appears in the header to specified locale

VCalendar/day-format.description: Formats day of the month string that appears in a day to a specified locale

VCalendar/now.description: Override the day & time which is considered now. This is in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`. The calendar is styled according to now.

VCalendar/events.description: An array of event objects with a property for a start timestamp and optionally a name and end timestamp. If an end timestamp is not given, the value of start will be used. If no name is given, you must provide an implementation for the `event` slot.

VCalendar/event-timed.description: If Dates or milliseconds are used as the start or end timestamp of an event, this prop can be a string to a property on the event that is truthy if the event is a timed event or a function which takes the event and returns a truthy value if the event is a timed event.

VCalendar/event-category.description: Set property of *event*'s category. Instead of a property a function can be given which takes an event and returns the category.

VCalendar/event-height.description: The height of an event in pixels in the `month` view and at the top of the `day` views.

VCalendar/event-color.description: A background color for all events or a function which accepts an event object passed to the calendar to return a color.

VCalendar/event-text-color.description: A text color for all events or a function which accepts an event object passed to the calendar to return a color.

VCalendar/event-name.type: | string | (( event: CalendarEventParsed, timedEvent: boolean, ) => string | VNode)
VCalendar/event-name.description: Set property of *event*'s displayed name, or a function which accepts an event object passed to the calendar as the first argument and a flag signalling whether the name is for a timed event (true) or an event over a day.

VCalendar/event-overlap-threshold.description: A value in minutes that's used to determine whether two timed events should be placed in column beside each other or should be treated as slightly overlapping events.

VCalendar/event-overlap-mode.type: | 'stack' | 'column' | (( events: CalendarEventParsed[], firstWeekday: number, overlapThreshold: number, ) => ( day: CalendarDaySlotScope, dayEvents: CalendarEventParsed[], timed: boolean, reset: boolean, ) => CalendarEventVisual[])
VCalendar/event-overlap-mode.description: One of `stack`, `column`, or a custom render function

VCalendar/event-more.description: Whether the more 'button' is displayed on a calendar with too many events in a given day. It will say something like '5 more' and when clicked generates a `click:more` event.

VCalendar/event-more-text.description: The text to display in the more 'button' given the number of hidden events.

VCard/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [replace](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) prop on the vue-router documentation.

VCard/link.description: Designates that the component is a link. This is automatic when using the href or to prop.

VCard/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VCard/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VCard/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VCard/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VCard/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VCard/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VCard/image.description: Apply a specific background image to the component.

VCard/location.description: Specifies the component's location. Can combine by using a space separated string.

VCard/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VCard/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VCard/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VCard/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VCard/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VCard/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VCard/prepend-icon.description: Prepends a [v-icon](/components/icons/) component to the header.

VCard/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VCard/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

VCard/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VCard/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VCard/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VCard/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VCard/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VCard/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VCard/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

VCard/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

VCard/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

VCard/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VCard/subtitle.description: Specify a subtitle text for the component.

VCard/append-avatar.description: Appends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VCard/hover.description: Applies **4dp** of elevation when hovered (default 2dp). You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VCard/prepend-avatar.description: Prepends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

VCardActions/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VCardItem/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VCardItem/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VCardItem/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VCardItem/prepend-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

VCardItem/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VCardItem/subtitle.description: Specify a subtitle text for the component.

VCardItem/append-avatar.description: Appends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VCardItem/prepend-avatar.description: Prepends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

VCardSubtitle/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VCardText/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VCardTitle/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VCarousel/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VCarousel/progress.description: Displays a carousel progress bar. Requires the **cycle** prop and **interval**.

VCarousel/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VCarousel/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VCarousel/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VCarousel/cycle.description: Determines if the carousel should cycle through images.

VCarousel/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VCarousel/color.description: Applies a color to the navigation dots - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VCarousel/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VCarousel/mandatory.description: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).

VCarousel/direction.description: The transition direction when changing windows.

VCarousel/interval.description: The duration between image cycles. Requires the **cycle** prop.

VCarousel/next-icon.description: The displayed icon for forcing pagination to the next item.

VCarousel/prev-icon.description: The displayed icon for forcing pagination to the previous item.

VCarousel/touch.description: Provide a custom **left** and **right** function when swiped left or right.

VCarousel/transition-duration.description: Overrides transition duration. Does not work in firefox, safari <18, or with `prefers-reduced-motion: reduce`.

VCarouselItem/alt.description: Alternate text for screen readers. Leave empty for decorative images.

VCarouselItem/disabled.description: Prevents the item from becoming active when using the "next" and "prev" buttons or the `toggle` method.

VCarouselItem/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VCarouselItem/src.type:
| string
  | { src: string; srcset: string; lazySrc: string; aspect: number }
VCarouselItem/src.description: The image URL. This prop is mandatory.

VCarouselItem/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VCarouselItem/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VCarouselItem/draggable.description: Controls the `draggable` behavior of the image. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/draggable).

VCarouselItem/absolute.description: Applies position: absolute to the component.

VCarouselItem/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VCarouselItem/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VCarouselItem/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VCarouselItem/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VCarouselItem/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VCarouselItem/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VCarouselItem/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VCarouselItem/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VCarouselItem/position.description: Applies [object-position](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/object-position) styles to the image and placeholder elements.

VCarouselItem/inline.description: Display as an inline element instead of a block, also disables flex-grow.

VCarouselItem/transition.description: The transition to use when switching from `lazy-src` to `src`. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VCarouselItem/content-class.description: Apply a custom class to the internal content element.

VCarouselItem/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VCarouselItem/options.description: Options that are passed to the [Intersection observer](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Intersection_Observer_API) constructor.

VCarouselItem/cover.description: Resizes the background image to cover the entire container.

VCarouselItem/gradient.description: The gradient to apply to the image. Only supports [linear-gradient](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/gradient/linear-gradient) syntax, anything else should be done with classes.

VCarouselItem/lazy-src.description:
Something to show while waiting for the main image to load, typically a small base64-encoded thumbnail. Has a slight blur filter applied.  
NOTE: This prop has no effect unless either `height` or `aspect-ratio` are provided.

VCarouselItem/srcset.description: A set of alternate images to use based on device size. [Read more...](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/img#attr-srcset).

VCarouselItem/aspect-ratio.description: Calculated as `width/height`, so for a 1920x1080px image this will be `1.7778`. Will be calculated automatically if omitted.

VCarouselItem/crossorigin.description: Specify that images should be fetched with CORS enabled [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/img#crossorigin)

VCarouselItem/referrerpolicy.description: Define which referrer is sent when fetching the resource [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/img#referrerpolicy)

VCheckbox/type.description: Provides the default type for children selection controls.

VCheckbox/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VCheckbox/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VCheckbox/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VCheckbox/indeterminate.description: Sets an indeterminate state for the checkbox.

VCheckbox/multiple.description: Changes expected model to an array.

VCheckbox/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VCheckbox/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VCheckbox/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VCheckbox/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VCheckbox/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VCheckbox/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VCheckbox/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VCheckbox/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VCheckbox/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VCheckbox/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VCheckbox/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VCheckbox/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VCheckbox/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VCheckbox/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VCheckbox/glow.description: Makes prepend/append icons full opacity when the input is focused and apply color.

VCheckbox/icon-color.description: Sets the color of the prepend/append icons.

VCheckbox/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VCheckbox/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VCheckbox/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VCheckbox/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VCheckbox/rules.type:
(
  | string
  | boolean
  | PromiseLike<ValidationResult>
  | ((value: any) => string | false | true)
  | ((value: any) => PromiseLike<ValidationResult>)
  | [string, any, string]
)[]
VCheckbox/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VCheckbox/validate-on.type:
| 'eager'
  | 'lazy'
  | 'blur'
  | 'input'
  | 'submit'
  | 'invalid-input'
  | 'blur lazy'
  | 'input lazy'
  | 'submit lazy'
  | 'invalid-input lazy'
  | 'blur eager'
  | 'input eager'
  | 'submit eager'
  | 'invalid-input eager'
  | 'lazy blur'
  | 'lazy input'
  | 'lazy submit'
  | 'lazy invalid-input'
  | 'eager blur'
  | 'eager input'
  | 'eager submit'
  | 'eager invalid-input'
VCheckbox/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

VCheckbox/validation-value.description: The value used when applying validation rules.

VCheckbox/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

VCheckbox/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display.

VCheckbox/indeterminate-icon.description: The icon used when in an indeterminate state.

VCheckbox/defaults-target.description: The target component to provide defaults values for.

VCheckbox/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VCheckboxBtn/type.description: Provides the default type for children selection controls.

VCheckboxBtn/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VCheckboxBtn/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VCheckboxBtn/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VCheckboxBtn/indeterminate.description: Puts the control in an indeterminate state. Used with the [indeterminate-icon](#props-indeterminate-icon) property.

VCheckboxBtn/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value.

VCheckboxBtn/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VCheckboxBtn/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VCheckboxBtn/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VCheckboxBtn/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VCheckboxBtn/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VCheckboxBtn/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VCheckboxBtn/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VCheckboxBtn/inline.description: Puts children inputs into a row.

VCheckboxBtn/indeterminate-icon.description: Icon used when the component is in an indeterminate state.

VCheckboxBtn/defaults-target.description: The target component to provide defaults values for.

VCheckboxBtn/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VChip/filter.description: Displays a selection icon when selected.

VChip/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [replace](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) prop on the vue-router documentation.

VChip/link.description: Designates that the component is a link. This is automatic when using the href or to prop.

VChip/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VChip/label.description: Applies a medium size border radius.

VChip/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VChip/size.description: Sets the height, padding and the font size of the component. Accepts only predefined options: **x-small**, **small**, **default**, **large**, and **x-large**.

VChip/value.description: The value used when a child of a [v-chip-group](/components/chip-groups).

VChip/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VChip/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VChip/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VChip/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VChip/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VChip/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VChip/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VChip/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VChip/base-color.description: Sets the color of component when not focused.

VChip/prepend-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

VChip/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VChip/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

VChip/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VChip/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

VChip/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

VChip/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

VChip/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VChip/active-class.description: The class applied to the component when it matches the current route. Find more information about the [active-class prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the [vue-router](https://router.vuejs.org/) documentation.

VChip/append-avatar.description: Appends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VChip/prepend-avatar.description: Prepends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

VChip/closable.description: Adds remove button and then a chip can be closed.

VChip/close-icon.description: Change the default icon used for **close** chips.

VChip/close-label.description: Text used for *aria-label* on the close button in **close** chips. Can also be customized globally in [Internationalization](/customization/internationalization).

VChip/filter-icon.description: Change the default icon used for **filter** chips.

VChipGroup/symbol.description: The [Symbol](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Symbol) used to hook into group functionality for components like [v-btn-toggle](/components/btn-toggle) and [v-bottom-navigation](/components/bottom-navigations/).

VChipGroup/filter.description: Applies an checkmark icon in front of every chip for using it like a filter.

VChipGroup/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VChipGroup/disabled.description: Puts all children components into a disabled state.

VChipGroup/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

VChipGroup/multiple.description: Allows one to select multiple items.

VChipGroup/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VChipGroup/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VChipGroup/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VChipGroup/base-color.description: Sets the color of component when not focused. Recommended with `color` or `filter` to properly highlight selected items.

VChipGroup/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VChipGroup/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VChipGroup/mobile.description: Determines the display mode of the component. If true, the component will be displayed in mobile mode. If false, the component will be displayed in desktop mode. If null, will be based on the current mobile-breakpoint

VChipGroup/mobile-breakpoint.description: Sets the designated mobile breakpoint for the component.

VChipGroup/mandatory.description: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).

VChipGroup/content-class.description: Adds classes to the slide group item.

VChipGroup/direction.description: Switch between horizontal and vertical modes.

VChipGroup/column.description: Remove horizontal pagination and wrap items as needed.

VChipGroup/next-icon.description: Specify the icon to use for the next icon.

VChipGroup/prev-icon.description: Specify the icon to use for the prev icon.

VChipGroup/show-arrows.description: Force the display of the pagination arrows.

VChipGroup/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VChipGroup/center-active.description: Forces the selected chip to be centered.

VChipGroup/scroll-to-active.description: Keeps the last active element visible when resizing the scrollable container.

VClassIcon/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VClassIcon/icon.description: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component.

VCode/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VCol/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VCol/order.description: Sets the default [order](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/order) for the column.

VCol/sm.description: Changes the number of columns on small and greater breakpoints.

VCol/md.description: Changes the number of columns on medium and greater breakpoints.

VCol/lg.description: Changes the number of columns on large and greater breakpoints.

VCol/xl.description: Changes the number of columns on extra large and greater breakpoints.

VCol/xxl.description: Changes the number of columns on extra extra large and greater breakpoints.

VCol/offset.description: Sets the default offset for the column.

VCol/cols.description: Sets the default number of columns the component extends. Available options are: **1 -> 12** and **auto**.

VCol/offset-sm.description: Changes the offset of the component on small and greater breakpoints.

VCol/offset-md.description: Changes the offset of the component on medium and greater breakpoints.

VCol/offset-lg.description: Changes the offset of the component on large and greater breakpoints.

VCol/offset-xl.description: Changes the offset of the component on extra large and greater breakpoints.

VCol/offset-xxl.description: Changes the offset of the component on extra extra large and greater breakpoints.

VCol/order-sm.description: Changes the order of the component on small and greater breakpoints.

VCol/order-md.description: Changes the order of the component on medium and greater breakpoints.

VCol/order-lg.description: Changes the order of the component on large and greater breakpoints.

VCol/order-xl.description: Changes the order of the component on extra large and greater breakpoints.

VCol/order-xxl.description: Changes the order of the component on extra extra large and greater breakpoints.

VCol/align-self.description: Applies the [align-items](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-items) css property. Available options are: **start**, **center**, **end**, **auto**, **baseline** and **stretch**.

VColorInput/flat.description: Removes box shadow when using a variant with elevation.

VColorInput/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VColorInput/mode.description: The current selected input type. Syncable with `v-model:mode`.

VColorInput/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VColorInput/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VColorInput/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VColorInput/autocomplete.description: Helps influence browser's suggestions. Special value **suppress** manipulates fields `name` attribute while **off** relies on browser's good will to stop suggesting values. Any other value is passed to the native `autocomplete` on the underlying element.

VColorInput/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the input.

VColorInput/width.description: Sets the width of the color picker.

VColorInput/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VColorInput/role.description: The role attribute applied to the input.

VColorInput/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VColorInput/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VColorInput/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VColorInput/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VColorInput/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VColorInput/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input.

VColorInput/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VColorInput/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VColorInput/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VColorInput/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the outside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VColorInput/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VColorInput/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VColorInput/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VColorInput/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VColorInput/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VColorInput/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VColorInput/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VColorInput/divided.description: Adds a divider between the header and controls.

VColorInput/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VColorInput/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VColorInput/glow.description: Makes prepend/append icons full opacity when the field is focused and apply color.

VColorInput/icon-color.description: Sets the color of the prepend/append icons.

VColorInput/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VColorInput/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VColorInput/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VColorInput/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VColorInput/rules.type:
(
  | string
  | boolean
  | PromiseLike<ValidationResult>
  | ((value: any) => string | false | true)
  | ((value: any) => PromiseLike<ValidationResult>)

VColorPicker/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VColorPicker/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VColorPicker/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VColorPicker/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VColorPicker/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VColorPicker/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VColorPicker/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VColorPicker/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VColorPicker/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VColorPicker/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VColorPicker/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VColorPicker/divided.description: Adds a divider between the header and controls.

VColorPicker/dot-size.description: Changes the size of the selection dot on the canvas.

VColorPicker/swatches-max-height.description: Sets the maximum height of the swatches section.

VColorPicker/landscape.description: Puts the picker into landscape mode.

VColorPicker/eye-dropper-icon.description: Icon used to trigger EyeDropper API.

VColorPicker/swatches.description: Sets the available color swatches to select from. 2D array of rows and columns, accepts any color format the picker does.

VCombobox/flat.description: Removes box shadow when using a variant with elevation.

VCombobox/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VCombobox/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VCombobox/menu.description: Renders with the menu open by default.

VCombobox/delimiters.description: Accepts an array of strings that will trigger a new tag when typing. Does not replace the normal Tab and Enter keys.

VCombobox/autocomplete.description: Helps influence browser's suggestions. Special value **suppress** manipulates fields `name` attribute while **off** relies on browser's good will to stop suggesting values. Any other value is passed to the native `autocomplete` on the underlying element.

VCombobox/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the input.

VCombobox/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value.

VCombobox/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VCombobox/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VCombobox/role.description: The role attribute applied to the input.

VCombobox/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VCombobox/items.description: Can be an array of objects or strings. By default objects should have **title** and **value** properties, and can optionally have a **props** property containing any [VListItem props](/api/v-list-item/#props). Keys to use for these can be changed with the **item-title**, **item-value**, and **item-props** props.

VCombobox/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VCombobox/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VCombobox/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VCombobox/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input.

VCombobox/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VCombobox/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VCombobox/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VCombobox/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the outside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VCombobox/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VCombobox/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VCombobox/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VCombobox/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VCombobox/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VCombobox/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VCombobox/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VCombobox/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VCombobox/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VCombobox/glow.description: Makes prepend/append icons full opacity when the field is focused and apply color.

VCombobox/icon-color.description: Sets the color of the prepend/append icons.

VCombobox/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VCombobox/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VCombobox/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VCombobox/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VCombobox/prepend-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend-inner** slot.

VCombobox/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty.

VCombobox/counter-value.description: Function returns the counter display text.

VCombobox/always-filter.description: When enabled, dropdown list will always show items matching non-empty value within the field. Recommended when the list is meant to show suggestions rather than options to choose from. For optimal UX, should be combined with `:menu-icon="false"` and `hide-selected`.

VCombobox/auto-select-first.description: When searching, will always highlight the first option and select it on blur. `exact` will only highlight and select exact matches.

VCombobox/clear-on-select.description: Reset the search text when a selection is made while using the **multiple** prop.

VCombobox/filter-mode.description:
Controls how the results of `customFilter` and `customKeyFilter` are combined. All modes only apply `customFilter` to columns not specified in `customKeyFilter`.

- **some**: There is at least one match from either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **every**: All columns match either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **union**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, or all columns match the custom key filters.
- **intersection**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, and all columns match the custom key filters.

VCombobox/custom-filter.description: Function used to filter items, called for each filterable key on each item in the list. The first argument is the filterable value from the item, the second is the search term, and the third is the internal item object. The function should return true if the item should be included in the filtered list, or the index of the match in the value if it should be included with the result highlighted.

VCombobox/custom-key-filter.description: Function used on specific keys within the item object. `customFilter` is skipped for columns with `customKeyFilter` specified.

VCombobox/filter-keys.description: Array of specific keys to filter on the item.

VCombobox/chips.description: Changes display of selections to chips.

VCombobox/closable-chips.description: Enables the [closable](/api/v-chip/#props-closable) prop on all [v-chip](/components/chips/) components.

VCombobox/hide-no-data.description: Hides the menu when there are no options to show.  Useful for preventing the menu from opening before results are fetched asynchronously.  Also has the effect of opening the menu when the `items` array changes if not already open.

VCombobox/hide-selected.description: Do not display in the select menu items that are already selected.

VCombobox/list-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-list` component. Accepts an object with anything from [v-list](/api/v-list/#props) props, camelCase keys are recommended.

VCombobox/item-title.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its title.

VCombobox/item-value.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its value.

VCombobox/item-props.description: Props object that will be applied to each item component. `true` will treat the original object as raw props and pass it directly to the component.

VCombobox/return-object.description: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**.

VCombobox/menu-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-menu` component. Accepts an object with anything from [v-menu](/api/v-menu/#props) props, camelCase keys are recommended.

VCombobox/no-data-text.description: Text shown when no items are provided to the component.

VCombobox/open-on-clear.description: Open's the menu whenever the clear icon is clicked.

VCombobox/close-text.description: Text set to the inputs `aria-label` and `title` when input menu is closed.

VCombobox/open-text.description: Text set to the inputs **aria-label** and **title** when input menu is open.

VComponentIcon/icon.description: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component.

VComponentIcon/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VConfirmEdit/disabled.description: Control the disabled state of action buttons. If not provided, internal logic will be used to determine the disabled state.

VConfirmEdit/hide-actions.description: Prevent showing the default actions buttons. Does not affect `<component :is="actions" />`

Controls how the results of `customFilter` and `customKeyFilter` are combined. All modes only apply `customFilter` to columns not specified in `customKeyFilter`.

- **some**: There is at least one match from either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **every**: All columns match either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **union**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, or all columns match the custom key filters.
- **intersection**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, and all columns match the custom key filters.

VDataIterator/custom-key-filter.description: Function used on specific keys within the item object. `customFilter` is skipped for columns with `customKeyFilter` specified.

VDataIterator/filter-keys.description: Array of specific keys to filter on the item.

VDataIterator/select-strategy.description: Defines the strategy of selecting items in the list. Possible values are: 'single' (only one item can be selected at a time), 'page' ('Select all' button will select only items on the current page), 'all' ('Select all' button will select all items in the list).

VDataIterator/item-value.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its value.

VDataIterator/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VDataIterator/loading.description: If `true` and no items are provided, then a loading text will be shown.

VDataIterator/item-selectable.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains the boolean value indicating if the item is selectable.

VDataIterator/show-select.description: Shows the column with checkboxes for selecting items in the list.

VDataIterator/initial-sort-order.description: Specifies the initial sort order when an **toggleSort** is called for unsorted property.

VDataIterator/sort-by.description: Array of column keys and sort orders that determines the sort order of the table.

VDataIterator/multi-sort.description:
Let user sort by multiple properties/columns.

- **key**: (optional) when set to `ctrl`, user is required to hold a keyboard key (Ctrl on PC and Command on Mac)
- **mode**: when user selects a new column to sort by, it will be set first (`prepend`) or last (`append`) in the sort priority. Defaults to `append`
- **modifier**: (optional) allows user to use both multi-sort modes (`append` and `prepend`) simultaneously

**Note**: object notation requires at least **v3.11.0**

VDataIterator/custom-key-sort.description: Function used on specific keys within the item object. `customSort` is skipped for columns with `customKeySort` specified.

VDataIterator/items-per-page.description: Changes how many items per page should be visible. Can be bound to external variable using **v-model:itemsPerPage**.. Setting this prop to `-1` will display all items on the page.

VDataIterator/expand-on-click.description: Expands item when the row is clicked.

VDataIterator/expanded.description: Array of expanded items. Can be bound to external variable using **v-model:expanded**.

VDataIterator/group-by.description: Configures attributes (and sort order) to group items together.

VDataTableServer/multi-sort.description:
Let user sort by multiple properties/columns.

- **key**: (optional) when set to `ctrl`, user is required to hold a keyboard key (Ctrl on PC and Command on Mac)
- **mode**: when user selects a new column to sort by, it will be set first (`prepend`) or last (`append`) in the sort priority. Defaults to `append`
- **modifier**: (optional) allows user to use both multi-sort modes (`append` and `prepend`) simultaneously

**Note**: object notation requires at least **v3.11.0**

VDataTableVirtual/filter-mode.description:
Controls how the results of `customFilter` and `customKeyFilter` are combined. All modes only apply `customFilter` to columns not specified in `customKeyFilter`.

- **some**: There is at least one match from either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **every**: All columns match either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **union**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, or all columns match the custom key filters.
- **intersection**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, and all columns match the custom key filters.

VDataTableVirtual/custom-filter.description: Function used to filter items, called for each filterable key on each item in the list. The first argument is the filterable value from the item, the second is the search term, and the third is the internal item object. The function should return true if the item should be included in the filtered list, or the index of the match in the value if it should be included with the result highlighted.

VDataTableVirtual/custom-key-filter.description: Function used on specific keys within the item object. `customFilter` is skipped for columns with `customKeyFilter` specified.

VDataTableVirtual/filter-keys.description: Array of specific keys to filter on the item.

VDataTableVirtual/select-strategy.description: Defines the strategy of selecting items in the list. Possible values are: 'single' (only one item can be selected at a time), 'page' ('Select all' button will select only items on the current page), 'all' ('Select all' button will select all items in the list).

VDateInput/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VDateInput/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

VDateInput/flat.description: Removes box shadow when using a variant with elevation.

VDateInput/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VDateInput/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VDateInput/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VDateInput/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VDateInput/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VDateInput/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VDateInput/location.description: Specifies the date picker's location. Can combine by using a space separated string.

VDateInput/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VDateInput/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input.

VDateInput/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VDateInput/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VDateInput/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VDateInput/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VDateInput/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VDateInput/autocomplete.description: Helps influence browser's suggestions. Special value **suppress** manipulates fields `name` attribute while **off** relies on browser's good will to stop suggesting values. Any other value is passed to the native `autocomplete` on the underlying element.

VDateInput/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the input.

VDateInput/multiple.description: Allow the selection of multiple dates. The **range** value selects all dates between two selections.

VDateInput/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VDateInput/role.description: The role attribute applied to the input.

VDateInput/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VDateInput/header.description: Text shown when no **display-date** is set.

VDateInput/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VDateInput/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VDateInput/menu.description: Renders with the menu open by default.

VDateInput/transition.description: The transition used when changing months into the future

VDateInput/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

VDateInput/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible.

VDateInput/persistent-counter.description: Forces counter to always be visible.

VDateInput/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VDateInput/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VDateInput/glow.description: Makes prepend/append icons full opacity when the field is focused and apply color.

VDateInput/icon-color.description: Sets the color of the prepend/append icons.

VDateInput/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the outside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VDateInput/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VDateInput/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VDateInput/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VDateInput/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VDateInput/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VDateInput/readonly.description: Makes the picker readonly (doesn't allow to select new date).

VDateInput/rules.type:
(
  | string
  | boolean
  | PromiseLike<ValidationResult>
  | ((value: any) => string | false | true)
  | ((value: any) => PromiseLike<ValidationResult>)
  | [string, any, string]
)[]
VDateInput/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.
