VMenu/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VMenu/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element the overlay content should teleport to. Can be a direct element reference, querySelector string, or `true` to disable teleporting. Uses `body` by default. Generally not recommended except as a last resort: the default positioning algorithm should handle most scenarios better than is possible without teleporting, and you may have unexpected behavior if the menu ends up as child of its activator.

VMessages/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VMessages/transition.type:
| string
  | boolean
  | (TransitionProps & { component: Component })
  | { component: Component; leaveAbsolute: boolean; group: boolean }
VMessages/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VMessages/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VMessages/active.description: Determines whether the messages are visible or not.

VNavigationDrawer/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VNavigationDrawer/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VNavigationDrawer/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VNavigationDrawer/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VNavigationDrawer/location.description: Controls the edge of the screen the drawer is attached to.

VNavigationDrawer/sticky.description: When true, the drawer will remain visible when scrolling past the top of the page.

VNavigationDrawer/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VNavigationDrawer/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VNavigationDrawer/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VNavigationDrawer/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VNavigationDrawer/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VNavigationDrawer/name.description: Assign a specific name for layout registration.

VNavigationDrawer/persistent.description: Clicking outside or pressing **esc** key will not dismiss the dialog.

VNavigationDrawer/scrim.description: Determines whether an overlay is used when a **temporary** drawer is open. Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

VNavigationDrawer/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VNavigationDrawer/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VNavigationDrawer/retain-focus.description: Captures and keeps focus within the content element when using **Tab** and **Shift**+**Tab**. Recommended to be `false` when using external tools that require focus such as TinyMCE or vue-clipboard.

VNavigationDrawer/image.description: Apply a specific background image to the component.

VNavigationDrawer/mobile.description: Determines the display mode of the component. If true, the component will be displayed in mobile mode. If false, the component will be displayed in desktop mode. If null, will be based on the current mobile-breakpoint

VNavigationDrawer/mobile-breakpoint.description: Sets the designated mobile breakpoint for the component. This will apply alternate styles for mobile devices such as the `temporary` prop, or activate the `bottom` prop when the breakpoint value is met. Setting the value to `0` will disable this functionality.

VNavigationDrawer/disable-resize-watcher.description: Prevents the automatic opening or closing of the drawer when resized, based on whether the device is mobile or desktop.

VNavigationDrawer/disable-route-watcher.description: Disables opening of navigation drawer when route changes.

VNavigationDrawer/expand-on-hover.description: Collapses the drawer to a **rail-variant** until hovering with the mouse.

VNavigationDrawer/floating.description: A floating drawer has no visible container (no border-right).

VNavigationDrawer/permanent.description: The drawer remains visible regardless of screen size.

VNavigationDrawer/rail.description: Sets the component width to the **rail-width** value.

VNavigationDrawer/rail-width.description: Sets the width for the component when `rail` is enabled.

VNavigationDrawer/temporary.description: A temporary drawer sits above its application and uses a scrim (overlay) to darken the background.

VNavigationDrawer/order.description: Adjust the order of the component in relation to its registration order.

VNumberInput/flat.description: Removes box shadow when using a variant with elevation.

VNumberInput/type.description: **IGNORED** underlying input is always of type 'text'

VNumberInput/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VNumberInput/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VNumberInput/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VNumberInput/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VNumberInput/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VNumberInput/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VNumberInput/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input.

VNumberInput/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VNumberInput/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VNumberInput/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VNumberInput/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VNumberInput/autocomplete.description: Helps influence browser's suggestions. Special value **suppress** manipulates fields `name` attribute while **off** relies on browser's good will to stop suggesting values. Any other value is passed to the native `autocomplete` on the underlying element.

VNumberInput/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the input.

VNumberInput/max.description: Specifies the maximum allowable value for the input.

VNumberInput/min.description: Specifies the minimum allowable value for the input.

VNumberInput/step.description: Defines the interval between allowed values when the user increments or decrements the input

VNumberInput/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VNumberInput/role.description: The role attribute applied to the input.

VNumberInput/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VNumberInput/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VNumberInput/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VNumberInput/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

VNumberInput/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible.

VNumberInput/persistent-counter.description: Forces counter to always be visible.

VNumberInput/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VNumberInput/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VNumberInput/glow.description: Makes prepend/append icons full opacity when the field is focused and apply color.

VNumberInput/icon-color.description: Sets the color of the prepend/append icons.

VNumberInput/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the outside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VNumberInput/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VNumberInput/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VNumberInput/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VNumberInput/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VNumberInput/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VNumberInput/rules.type:
(
  | string
  | boolean
  | PromiseLike<ValidationResult>
  | ((value: any) => string | false | true)
  | ((value: any) => PromiseLike<ValidationResult>)
  | [string, any, string]
)[]
VNumberInput/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VNumberInput/validate-on.type:
| 'eager'
  | 'lazy'
  | 'blur'
  | 'input'
  | 'submit'
  | 'invalid-input'
  | 'blur lazy'
  | 'input lazy'
  | 'submit lazy'
  | 'invalid-input lazy'
  | 'blur eager'
  | 'input eager'
  | 'submit eager'
  | 'invalid-input eager'
  | 'lazy blur'
  | 'lazy input'
  | 'lazy submit'
  | 'lazy invalid-input'
  | 'eager blur'
  | 'eager input'
  | 'eager submit'
  | 'eager invalid-input'
VNumberInput/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

VNumberInput/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

VNumberInput/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display.

VNumberInput/append-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **append-inner** slot.

VNumberInput/clearable.description: Allows for the component to be cleared.

VNumberInput/clear-icon.description: The icon used when the **clearable** prop is set to true.

VNumberInput/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VNumberInput/dirty.description: Manually apply the dirty state styling.

VNumberInput/persistent-clear.description: Always show the clearable icon when the input is dirty (By default it only shows on hover).

VNumberInput/prepend-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend-inner** slot.

VNumberInput/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty.

VNumberInput/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VNumberInput/counter-value.description: Function returns the counter display text.

VNumberInput/control-variant.description: The color of the control. It defaults to the value of `variant` prop.

VNumberInput/inset.description: Applies an indentation to the dividers used in the stepper buttons.

VNumberInput/precision.description: Enforces strict precision. It is expected to be an integer value in range between `0` and `15`, or null for unrestricted.

VNumberInput/min-fraction-digits.description: Specifies the minimum fraction digits to be displayed (capped to `precision`). Defaults to `precision` when not explicitly set.

VNumberInput/decimal-separator.description: Expects single character to be used as decimal separator.

VOtpInput/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VOtpInput/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VOtpInput/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the input.

VOtpInput/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VOtpInput/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VOtpInput/autofocus.description: Automatically focuses the first input on page load

VOtpInput/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VOtpInput/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VOtpInput/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VOtpInput/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VOtpInput/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VOtpInput/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VOtpInput/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VOtpInput/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VOtpInput/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VOtpInput/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VOtpInput/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VOtpInput/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VOtpInput/divider.description: Specifies the dividing character between items.

VOtpInput/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

VOtpInput/focus-all.description: Puts all inputs into a focus state when any are focused

VOverlay/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VOverlay/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VOverlay/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VOverlay/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VOverlay/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VOverlay/location.description: Specifies the anchor point for positioning the component, using directional cues to align it either horizontally, vertically, or both..

VOverlay/absolute.description: Applies **position: absolute** to the content element.

VOverlay/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VOverlay/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VOverlay/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VOverlay/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VOverlay/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VOverlay/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

VOverlay/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`. (Note: The parent element must have position: relative.).

VOverlay/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

VOverlay/content-props.description: Apply custom properties to the content.

VOverlay/opacity.description: Sets the opacity of the scrim element. Only applies if `scrim` is enabled.

VOverlay/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of the content element when using the persistent prop.

VOverlay/persistent.description: Clicking outside of the element or pressing esc key will not deactivate it.

VOverlay/scrim.description: Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

VOverlay/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component.

VOverlay/target.description: For locationStrategy="connected", specify an element or array of x,y coordinates that the overlay should position itself relative to. This will be the activator element by default.

VOverlay/activator-props.description: Apply custom properties to the activator.

VOverlay/open-on-click.description: Activate the component when the activator is clicked.

VOverlay/open-on-hover.description: Activate the component when the activator is hovered.

VOverlay/open-on-focus.description: Activate the component when the activator is focused.

VOverlay/close-on-content-click.description: Closes component when you click on its content.

VOverlay/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VOverlay/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VOverlay/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VOverlay/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator.

VOverlay/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VOverlay/offset.description: Increases distance from the target. When passed as a pair of numbers, the second value shifts anchor along the side and away from the target.

VOverlay/stick-to-target.description: Enables the overlay content to go off-screen when scrolling.

VOverlay/viewport-margin.description: Sets custom viewport margin for the overlay content

VOverlay/scroll-strategy.description: Strategy used when the component is activate and user scrolls.

VOverlay/retain-focus.description: Captures and keeps focus within the content element when using **Tab** and **Shift**+**Tab**. Recommended to be `false` when using external tools that require focus such as TinyMCE or vue-clipboard.

VOverlay/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element the overlay content should teleport to. Can be a direct element reference, querySelector string, or `true` to disable teleporting. Uses `body` by default.

VPagination/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VPagination/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VPagination/size.description: Sets the height and width of the component. Default unit is px. Can also use the following predefined sizes: **x-small**, **small**, **default**, **large**, and **x-large**.

VPagination/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VPagination/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VPagination/color.description: Applies specified color to the selected page button - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VPagination/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VPagination/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VPagination/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VPagination/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VPagination/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VPagination/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VPagination/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VPagination/next-icon.description: The icon to use for the next button.

VPagination/prev-icon.description: The icon to use for the prev button.

VPagination/total-visible.description: Specify the total visible pagination numbers.

VPagination/first-icon.description: The icon to use for the first button.

VPagination/last-icon.description: The icon to use for the last button.

VPagination/current-page-aria-label.description: Label for the currently selected page.

VPagination/first-aria-label.description: Label for the go to first button.

VPagination/last-aria-label.description: Label for the go to last button.

VPagination/ellipsis.description: Text to show between page buttons when truncating the list.

VPagination/show-first-last-page.description: Show buttons for going to first and last page.

VParallax/scale.description: The scale of the parallax image.

VPicker/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VPicker/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VPicker/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VPicker/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VPicker/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VPicker/location.description: Specifies the component's location. Can combine by using a space separated string.

VPicker/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VPicker/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VPicker/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VPicker/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VPicker/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VPicker/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VPicker/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VPicker/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VPicker/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VPicker/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VPicker/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VPicker/divided.description: Adds a divider between the header and controls.

VPicker/landscape.description: Puts the picker into landscape mode.

VPickerTitle/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VPie/legend.type:
| boolean
  | {
      position: 'top' | 'left' | 'right' | 'bottom'
      textFormat:
        | string
        | ((v: {
            key: string | number | symbol
            color: string
            value: number
            title: string
            pattern: string
            isActive: boolean
            raw: Record<string, any>
          }) => string)
    }
VPie/legend.description: Controls legend visibility, position and text format.

VPie/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VPie/size.description: Sets the height and width of the chart (excluding title and legend).

VPie/items.type: Record<string, any> | { color: string; pattern: string }[]
VPie/items.description: Data items expected to contain `key`, `title` and `value`.

VPie/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VPie/rounded.description: Number passed as corner radius relative to 100x100 SVG viewport

VPie/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VPie/tooltip.type:
| boolean
  | {
      titleFormat:
        | string
        | ((v: {
            key: string | number | symbol
            color: string
            value: number
            title: string
            pattern: string
            isActive: boolean
            raw: Record<string, any>
          }) => string)
      subtitleFormat:
        | string
        | ((v: {
            key: string | number | symbol
            color: string
            value: number
            title: string
            pattern: string
            isActive: boolean
            raw: Record<string, any>
          }) => string)
      avatarSize: number
      transition: string | false | true | TransitionProps
      offset: number
    }
VPie/tooltip.description: Controls tooltip visibility, transition, offset from the cursor and formats of title and subtitle.

VPie/palette.description: Defines colors and patterns to be applied based on the data items order. Data items can also define their colors.

VPie/gauge-cut.description: Allows removing bottom part of the chart to make it into a gauge. Expects angle (0-180).

VPie/inner-cut.description: Specifies inner radius for a donut-style chart as a percent (0-100). Without `hide-slice`, inner slice is visible with translucent color matching the item.

VPie/hover-scale.description: Enables interactive behavior by reducing segment size until it gets hovered. Expects fraction value (0-0.25).

VPie/gap.description: Reduces segment size by a specified angle. Recommended to in range (0-10).

VPie/animation.description: Controls duration and easing of the expand/collapse and hover effect. Defaults to `easeInOutCubic` over 400ms.

VPie/hide-slice.description: Makes inner slice invisible instead of semi-transparent.

VPie/reveal.description: Enables and controls duration for initial reveal animation. Easing function is shared with `animation` prop.

VPieSegment/pattern.description: Decal pattern to put on top of the outer slice.

VPieSegment/value.description: The value used for calculate segment/arc angle size.

VPieSegment/color.description: Sets segment color to be passed straight to CSS style attribute.

VPieSegment/rounded.description: Number passed as corner radius relative to 100x100 SVG viewport

VPieSegment/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VPieSegment/inner-cut.description: Sets inner slice size in percent (0-100).

VPieSegment/hover-scale.description: Reduces outer radius until segment is hovered. Expects fraction value (0-0.25)

VPieSegment/gap.description: Reduces segment size by a specified angle. Recommended to in range (0-10).

VPieSegment/animation.description: Controls duration and easing of the expand/collapse and hover effect. Defaults to `easeInOutCubic` over 400ms.

VPieSegment/hide-slice.description: Makes inner slice invisible instead of semi-transparent.

VPieSegment/reveal.description: Enables and controls duration for initial reveal animation. Easing function is shared with `animation` prop.

VPieTooltip/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VPieTooltip/transition.description: The transition used when hovering between chart segments

VPieTooltip/offset.description: Increases distance from the target. When passed as a pair of numbers, the second value shifts anchor along the side and away from the target.

VPieTooltip/item.type:
{
  key: string | number | symbol
  color: string
  value: number
  title: string
  pattern: string
  isActive: boolean
  raw: Record<string, any>
}
VPieTooltip/item.description: Data item related to hovered segment

VPieTooltip/title-format.type:
| string
  | ((v: {
      key: string | number | symbol
      color: string
      value: number
      title: string
      pattern: string
      isActive: boolean
      raw: Record<string, any>
    }) => string)
VPieTooltip/title-format.description: Formatter definition or function. When passed as String macros for `[title]` and `[value]` get replaced dynamically.

VPieTooltip/subtitle-format.type:
| string
  | ((v: {
      key: string | number | symbol
      color: string
      value: number
      title: string
      pattern: string
      isActive: boolean
      raw: Record<string, any>
    }) => string)
VPieTooltip/subtitle-format.description: Formatter definition or function. When passed as String macros for `[title]` and `[value]` get replaced dynamically.

VProgressCircular/model-value.description: The percentage value for current progress.

VProgressCircular/width.description: Sets the stroke of the circle in pixels.

VProgressCircular/rounded.description: Rounds the ends of the progress arc for a softer appearance. When enabled, the progress stroke will have rounded caps instead of square ends.

VProgressCircular/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VProgressCircular/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VProgressCircular/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VProgressCircular/indeterminate.description: Constantly animates, use when loading progress is unknown. If set to the string `'disable-shrink'` it will use a simpler animation that does not run on the main thread.

VProgressCircular/size.description: Sets the diameter of the circle in pixels.

VProgressCircular/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VProgressCircular/rotate.description: Rotates the circle start point in degrees.

VProgressLinear/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VProgressLinear/reverse.description: Displays reversed progress (right to left in LTR mode and left to right in RTL).

VProgressLinear/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VProgressLinear/indeterminate.description: Constantly animates, use when loading progress is unknown.

VProgressLinear/max.description: Sets the maximum value the progress can reach.

VProgressLinear/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VProgressLinear/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VProgressLinear/location.description: Specifies the component's location. Can combine by using a space separated string.

VProgressLinear/absolute.description: Applies position: absolute to the component.

VProgressLinear/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VProgressLinear/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VProgressLinear/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VProgressLinear/active.description: Reduce the height to 0, hiding component.

VProgressLinear/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VProgressLinear/opacity.description: Set the opacity of the progress bar.

VProgressLinear/stream.description: An alternative style for portraying loading that works in tandem with **buffer-value**.

VProgressLinear/bg-opacity.description: Background opacity, if null it defaults to 0.3 if background color is not specified or 1 otherwise.

VProgressLinear/buffer-value.description: The percentage value for the buffer.

VProgressLinear/buffer-color.description: Sets the color of the buffer bar.

VProgressLinear/buffer-opacity.description: Set the opacity of the buffer bar.

VProgressLinear/clickable.description: Clicking on the progress track will automatically set the value.

VProgressLinear/striped.description: Adds a stripe background to the filled portion of the progress component.

VProgressLinear/rounded-bar.description: Applies a border radius to the progress bar.

VProgressLinear/chunk-count.description: Specifies amount of chunks to divide the bar into.

VProgressLinear/chunk-width.description: Defines chunk absolute size. Useful when chunk is narrow.

VProgressLinear/chunk-gap.description: Defines size of the gap between chunks.

VPullToRefresh/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VPullToRefresh/pull-down-threshold.description: The distance the user must pull down to trigger a refresh.

VRadio/type.description: Provides the default type for children selection controls.

VRadio/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VRadio/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VRadio/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VRadio/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value.

VRadio/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VRadio/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VRadio/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VRadio/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VRadio/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VRadio/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VRadio/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VRadio/inline.description: Puts children inputs into a row.

VRadio/defaults-target.description: The target component to provide defaults values for.

VRadio/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VRadioGroup/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VRadioGroup/glow.description: Makes prepend/append icons full opacity when the input is focused and apply color.

VRadioGroup/icon-color.description: Sets the color of the prepend/append icons.

VRadioGroup/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VRadioGroup/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VRadioGroup/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VRadioGroup/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VRadioGroup/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VRadioGroup/rules.type:
(
  | string
  | boolean
  | PromiseLike<ValidationResult>

  | ((value: any) => PromiseLike<ValidationResult>)
  | [string, any, string]
)[]
VRadioGroup/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VRangeSlider/thumb-label.description: Show thumb label. If `true` it shows label when using slider. If set to `'always'` it always shows label.

VRangeSlider/strict.description: Disallows dragging the ending thumb past the starting thumb and vice versa.

VRating/length.description: The amount of items to show.

VRating/readonly.description: Removes all hover effects and pointer events.

VResponsive/content-class.description: Apply a custom class to the internal content element.

VResponsive/inline.description: Display as an inline element instead of a block, also disables flex-grow.

VRow/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VSelect/flat.description: Removes box shadow when using a variant with elevation.

VSelect/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VSelect/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VSelect/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VSelect/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VSelect/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width of the select's `v-menu` content.

VSelect/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VSelect/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input.

VSelect/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VSelect/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VSelect/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSelect/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VSelect/autocomplete.description: Helps influence browser's suggestions. Special value **suppress** manipulates fields `name` attribute while **off** relies on browser's good will to stop suggesting values. Any other value is passed to the native `autocomplete` on the underlying element.

VSelect/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the input.

VSelect/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value.

VSelect/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VSelect/role.description: The role attribute applied to the input.

VSelect/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VSelect/chips.description: Changes display of selections to chips.

VSelect/closable-chips.description: Enables the [closable](/api/v-chip/#props-closable) prop on all [v-chip](/components/chips/) components.

VSelect/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VSelect/hide-no-data.description: Hides the menu when there are no options to show.  Useful for preventing the menu from opening before results are fetched asynchronously.  Also has the effect of opening the menu when the `items` array changes if not already open.

VSelect/hide-selected.description: Do not display in the select menu items that are already selected.

VSelect/list-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-list` component. Accepts an object with anything from [v-list](/api/v-list/#props) props, camelCase keys are recommended.

VSelect/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VSelect/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSelect/items.description: Can be an array of objects or strings. By default objects should have **title** and **value** properties, and can optionally have a **props** property containing any [VListItem props](/api/v-list-item/#props). Keys to use for these can be changed with the **item-title**, **item-value**, and **item-props** props.

VSelect/item-title.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its title.

VSelect/item-value.description: Set property of **items**'s value - **must be primitive**. Dot notation is supported. **Note:** This is currently not supported with `v-combobox` [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/issues/5479).

VSelect/item-props.description: Props object that will be applied to each item component. `true` will treat the original object as raw props and pass it directly to the component.

VSelect/return-object.description: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**.

VSelect/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VSelect/menu.description: Renders with the menu open by default.

VSelect/menu-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-menu` component. Accepts an object with anything from [v-menu](/api/v-menu/#props) props, camelCase keys are recommended.

VSelect/transition.type:
| string
  | boolean
  | (TransitionProps & { component: Component })
  | { component: Component }
VSelect/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VSelect/no-data-text.description: Text shown when no items are provided to the component.

VSelect/open-on-clear.description: When using the **clearable** prop, once cleared, the select menu will either open or stay open, depending on the current state.

VSelect/no-auto-scroll.description: Prevents the select menu to scroll to the selected item automatically.

VSelect/close-text.description: Text set to the inputs `aria-label` and `title` when input menu is closed.

VSelect/open-text.description: Text set to the inputs **aria-label** and **title** when input menu is open.

VSelect/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

VSelect/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible.

VSelect/persistent-counter.description: Forces counter to always be visible.

VSelect/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VSelect/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VSelect/glow.description: Makes prepend/append icons full opacity when the field is focused and apply color.

VSelect/icon-color.description: Sets the color of the prepend/append icons.

VSelect/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the outside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VSelect/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VSelect/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VSelect/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VSelect/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VSelect/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VSelect/rules.type:
(
  | string
  | boolean
  | PromiseLike<ValidationResult>
  | ((value: any) => string | false | true)
  | ((value: any) => PromiseLike<ValidationResult>)
  | [string, any, string]
)[]
VSelect/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VSelect/validate-on.type:
| 'eager'
  | 'lazy'
  | 'blur'
  | 'input'
  | 'submit'
  | 'invalid-input'
  | 'blur lazy'
  | 'input lazy'
  | 'submit lazy'
  | 'invalid-input lazy'
  | 'blur eager'
  | 'input eager'
  | 'submit eager'
  | 'invalid-input eager'
  | 'lazy blur'
  | 'lazy input'
  | 'lazy submit'
  | 'lazy invalid-input'
  | 'eager blur'
  | 'eager input'
  | 'eager submit'
  | 'eager invalid-input'
VSelect/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

VSelect/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

VSelect/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display.

VSelect/append-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **append-inner** slot.

VSelect/clearable.description: Allows for the component to be cleared.

VSelect/clear-icon.description: The icon used when the **clearable** prop is set to true.

VSelect/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VSelect/persistent-clear.description: Always show the clearable icon when the input is dirty (By default it only shows on hover).

VSelect/prepend-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend-inner** slot.

VSelect/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty.

VSelect/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VSelect/counter-value.description: Function returns the counter display text.

VSelectionControl/type.description: Provides the default type for children selection controls.

VSelectionControl/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VSelectionControl/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VSelectionControl/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VSelectionControl/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value.

VSelectionControl/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VSelectionControl/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VSelectionControl/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VSelectionControl/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VSelectionControl/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSelectionControl/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VSelectionControl/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VSelectionControl/inline.description: Puts children inputs into a row.

VSelectionControl/defaults-target.description: The target component to provide defaults values for.

VSelectionControl/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VSelectionControlGroup/type.description: Provides the default type for children selection controls.

VSelectionControlGroup/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VSelectionControlGroup/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VSelectionControlGroup/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value.

VSelectionControlGroup/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VSelectionControlGroup/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VSelectionControlGroup/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VSelectionControlGroup/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSelectionControlGroup/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VSelectionControlGroup/inline.description: Puts children inputs into a row.

VSelectionControlGroup/defaults-target.description: The target component to provide defaults values for.

VSelectionControlGroup/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VSheet/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VSheet/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VSheet/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VSheet/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VSheet/location.description: Specifies the component's location. Can combine by using a space separated string.

VSheet/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSheet/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VSheet/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VSheet/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VSheet/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VSheet/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VSheet/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VSheet/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VSheet/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VSheet/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VSkeletonLoader/type.description: A string delimited list of skeleton components to create such as `type="text@3"` or `type="card, list-item"`. Will recursively generate a corresponding skeleton from the provided string. Also supports short-hand for multiple elements such as **article@3** and **paragraph@2** which will generate 3 _article_ skeletons and 2 _paragraph_ skeletons. Please see below for a list of available pre-defined options.

VSkeletonLoader/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VSkeletonLoader/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VSkeletonLoader/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VSkeletonLoader/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSkeletonLoader/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VSkeletonLoader/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VSkeletonLoader/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VSkeletonLoader/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VSkeletonLoader/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VSkeletonLoader/loading.description: Applies a loading animation with a on-hover loading cursor. A value of **false** will only work when there is content in the `default` slot.

VSkeletonLoader/boilerplate.description: Remove the loading animation from the skeleton.

VSkeletonLoader/loading-text.description: aria-label for the element in a loading state.

VSlideGroup/symbol.description: The [Symbol](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Symbol) used to hook into group functionality for components like [v-btn-toggle](/components/btn-toggle) and [v-bottom-navigation](/components/bottom-navigations/).

VSlideGroup/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VSlideGroup/disabled.description: Puts all children components into a disabled state.

VSlideGroup/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

VSlideGroup/multiple.description: Allows one to select multiple items.

VSlideGroup/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VSlideGroup/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VSlideGroup/mobile.description: Determines the display mode of the component. If true, the component will be displayed in mobile mode. If false, the component will be displayed in desktop mode. If null, will be based on the current mobile-breakpoint

VSlideGroup/mobile-breakpoint.description: Sets the designated mobile breakpoint for the component.

VSlideGroup/mandatory.description: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).

VSlideGroup/content-class.description: Adds classes to the slide group item.

VSlideGroup/direction.description: Switch between horizontal and vertical modes.

VSlideGroup/next-icon.description: The appended slot when arrows are shown.

VSlideGroup/prev-icon.description: The prepended slot when arrows are shown.

VSlideGroup/show-arrows.description: Change when the overflow arrow indicators are shown. By **default**, arrows *always* display on Desktop when the container is overflowing. When the container overflows on mobile, arrows are not shown by default. A **show-arrows** value of `true` allows these arrows to show on Mobile if the container overflowing. A value of `desktop` *always* displays arrows on Desktop while a value of `mobile` always displays arrows on Mobile. A value of `always` always displays arrows on Desktop *and* Mobile. Use **never** to turn arrows off. Find more information on how to customize breakpoint thresholds on the [breakpoints page](/customizing/breakpoints).

VSlideGroup/center-active.description: Forces the selected component to be centered.

VSlideGroup/scroll-to-active.description: Keeps the last active element visible when resizing the scrollable container.

VSlideGroupItem/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VSlideGroupItem/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VSlideGroupItem/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VSlideXReverseTransition/mode.description: Sets the transition mode (does not apply to transition-group). You can find more information on the Vue documentation [for transition modes](https://vuejs.org/api/built-in-components.html#transition).

VSlideXReverseTransition/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VSlideXReverseTransition/group.description: Creates a `transition-group` component. You can find more information in the [vue docs](https://vuejs.org/api/built-in-components.html#transitiongroup).

VSlideXReverseTransition/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VSlideXReverseTransition/hide-on-leave.description: Hides the leaving element (no exit animation).

VSlideXReverseTransition/leave-absolute.description: Absolutely positions the leaving element (useful for [FLIP](https://aerotwist.com/blog/flip-your-animations/)).

VSlideXTransition/mode.description: Sets the transition mode (does not apply to transition-group). You can find more information on the Vue documentation [for transition modes](https://vuejs.org/api/built-in-components.html#transition).

VSlideXTransition/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VSlideXTransition/group.description: Creates a `transition-group` component. You can find more information in the [vue docs](https://vuejs.org/api/built-in-components.html#transitiongroup).

VSlideXTransition/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VSlideXTransition/hide-on-leave.description: Hides the leaving element (no exit animation).

VSlideXTransition/leave-absolute.description: Absolutely positions the leaving element (useful for [FLIP](https://aerotwist.com/blog/flip-your-animations/)).

VSlideYReverseTransition/mode.description: Sets the transition mode (does not apply to transition-group). You can find more information on the Vue documentation [for transition modes](https://vuejs.org/api/built-in-components.html#transition).

VSlideYReverseTransition/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VSlideYReverseTransition/group.description: Creates a `transition-group` component. You can find more information in the [vue docs](https://vuejs.org/api/built-in-components.html#transitiongroup).

VSlideYReverseTransition/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VSlideYReverseTransition/leave-absolute.description: Absolutely positions the leaving element (useful for [FLIP](https://aerotwist.com/blog/flip-your-animations/)).

VSlideYTransition/mode.description: Sets the transition mode (does not apply to transition-group). You can find more information on the Vue documentation [for transition modes](https://vuejs.org/api/built-in-components.html#transition).

VSlideYTransition/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VSlideYTransition/leave-absolute.description: Absolutely positions the leaving element (useful for [FLIP](https://aerotwist.com/blog/flip-your-animations/)).

VSlider/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VSlider/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VSlider/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VSlider/step.description: If greater than 0, sets step interval for ticks.

VSlider/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VSlider/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VSlider/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VSlider/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VSlider/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSlider/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VSlider/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VSlider/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VSlider/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VSlider/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VSlider/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VSlider/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VSlider/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VSlider/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VSlider/direction.description: Changes the direction of the input.

VSlider/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VSlider/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VSlider/glow.description: Makes prepend/append icons full opacity when the input is focused and apply color.

VSlider/icon-color.description: Sets the color of the prepend/append icons.

VSlider/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VSlider/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VSlider/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VSlider/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VSlider/rules.type:
(
  | string
  | boolean
  | PromiseLike<ValidationResult>
  | ((value: any) => string | false | true)
  | ((value: any) => PromiseLike<ValidationResult>)
  | [string, any, string]
)[]
VSlider/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VSlider/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

VSlider/validation-value.description: The value used when applying validation rules.

VSlider/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

VSlider/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display.

VSlider/thumb-color.description: Sets the thumb and thumb label color.

VSlider/thumb-label.description: Show thumb label. If `true` it shows label when using slider. If set to `'always'` it always shows label.

VSlider/thumb-size.description: Controls the size of the thumb label.

VSlider/show-ticks.description: Show track ticks. If `true` it shows ticks when using slider. If set to `'always'` it always shows ticks.

VSlider/ticks.description: Show track ticks. If `true` it shows ticks when using slider. If set to `'always'` it always shows ticks.

VSlider/no-keyboard.description: **FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY** Ignore keyboard events.

VSnackbar/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VSnackbar/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VSnackbar/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VSnackbar/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VSnackbar/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VSnackbar/location.description: Specifies the anchor point for positioning the component, using directional cues to align it either horizontally, vertically, or both..

VSnackbar/absolute.description: Applies **position: absolute** to the content element.

VSnackbar/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSnackbar/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VSnackbar/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VSnackbar/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

VSnackbar/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VSnackbar/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VSnackbar/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VSnackbar/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VSnackbar/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VSnackbar/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VSnackbar/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VSnackbar/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

VSnackbar/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`. (Note: The parent element must have position: relative.).

VSnackbar/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

VSnackbar/content-props.description: Apply custom properties to the content.

VSnackbar/opacity.description: Sets the opacity of the scrim element. Only applies if `scrim` is enabled.

VSnackbar/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component.

VSnackbar/target.description: For locationStrategy="connected", specify an element or array of x,y coordinates that the overlay should position itself relative to. This will be the activator element by default.

VSnackbar/activator-props.description: Apply custom properties to the activator.

VSnackbar/open-on-click.description: Activate the component when the activator is clicked.

VSnackbar/open-on-hover.description: Activate the component when the activator is hovered.

VSnackbar/open-on-focus.description: Activate the component when the activator is focused.

VSnackbar/close-on-content-click.description: Closes component when you click on its content.

VSnackbar/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VSnackbar/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VSnackbar/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VSnackbar/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator.

VSnackbar/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VSnackbar/offset.description: Increases distance from the target. When passed as a pair of numbers, the second value shifts anchor along the side and away from the target.

VSnackbar/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element the overlay content should teleport to. Can be a direct element reference, querySelector string, or `true` to disable teleporting. Uses `body` by default.

VSnackbar/vertical.description: Stacks snackbar content on top of the actions (button).

VSnackbar/multi-line.description: Deprecated, use `min-height` instead. Increases minimum height.

VSnackbar/timer.description: Display a progress bar that counts down until the snackbar closes. Pass a string to set a custom color, otherwise uses `info`.

VSnackbar/timeout.description: Time (in milliseconds) to wait until snackbar is automatically hidden.  Use `-1` to keep open indefinitely (`0` in version < 2.3 ). It is recommended for this number to be between `4000` and `10000`. Changes to this property will reset the timeout.

VSnackbarQueue/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VSnackbarQueue/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VSnackbarQueue/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VSnackbarQueue/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.
