VSnackbarQueue/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VSnackbarQueue/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

VSnackbarQueue/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VSnackbarQueue/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VSnackbarQueue/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VSnackbarQueue/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VSnackbarQueue/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VSnackbarQueue/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VSnackbarQueue/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VSnackbarQueue/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

VSnackbarQueue/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`. (Note: The parent element must have position: relative.).

VSnackbarQueue/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

VSnackbarQueue/content-props.description: Apply custom properties to the content.

VSnackbarQueue/opacity.description: Sets the opacity of the scrim element. Only applies if `scrim` is enabled.

VSnackbarQueue/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component.

VSnackbarQueue/target.description: For locationStrategy="connected", specify an element or array of x,y coordinates that the overlay should position itself relative to. This will be the activator element by default.

VSnackbarQueue/activator-props.description: Apply custom properties to the activator.

VSnackbarQueue/open-on-click.description: Activate the component when the activator is clicked.

VSnackbarQueue/open-on-hover.description: Activate the component when the activator is hovered.

VSnackbarQueue/open-on-focus.description: Activate the component when the activator is focused.

VSnackbarQueue/close-on-content-click.description: Closes component when you click on its content.

VSnackbarQueue/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VSnackbarQueue/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VSnackbarQueue/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VSnackbarQueue/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator.

VSnackbarQueue/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VSnackbarQueue/offset.description: Increases distance from the target. When passed as a pair of numbers, the second value shifts anchor along the side and away from the target.

VSnackbarQueue/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element the overlay content should teleport to. Can be a direct element reference, querySelector string, or `true` to disable teleporting. Uses `body` by default.

VSnackbarQueue/vertical.description: Stacks snackbar content on top of the actions (button).

VSnackbarQueue/closable.description: Adds a dismiss button that closes the active snackbar.

VSnackbarQueue/close-text.description: The text used in the close button when using the **closable** prop.

VSnackbarQueue/multi-line.description: Deprecated, use `min-height` instead. Increases minimum height.

VSnackbarQueue/timer.description: Display a progress bar that counts down until the snackbar closes. Pass a string to set a custom color, otherwise uses `info`.

VSnackbarQueue/timeout.description: Time (in milliseconds) to wait until snackbar is automatically hidden.  Use `-1` to keep open indefinitely (`0` in version < 2.3 ). It is recommended for this number to be between `4000` and `10000`. Changes to this property will reset the timeout.

VSpacer/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VSparkline/type.description: Choose between a trendline or bars.

VSparkline/fill.description: Using the **fill** property allows you to better customize the look and feel of your sparkline.

VSparkline/height.description: Height of the SVG trendline or bars.

VSparkline/labels.description: An array of string labels that correspond to the same index as its data counterpart.

VSparkline/max.description: The maximum value of the sparkline.

VSparkline/min.description: The minimum value of the sparkline.

VSparkline/width.description: Width of the SVG trendline or bars.

VSparkline/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VSparkline/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSparkline/gradient.description: An array of colors to use as a linear-gradient.

VSparkline/auto-line-width.description: Automatically expand bars to use space efficiently.

VSparkline/auto-draw.description: Trace the length of the line when first rendered.

VSparkline/auto-draw-duration.description: Amount of time (in ms) to run the trace animation.

VSparkline/auto-draw-easing.description: The easing function to use for the trace animation.

VSparkline/gradient-direction.description: The direction the gradient should run.

VSparkline/line-width.description: The thickness of the line, in px.

VSparkline/padding.description: Low `smooth` or high `line-width` values may result in cropping, increase padding to compensate.

VSparkline/show-labels.description: Show labels below each data point.

VSparkline/smooth.description: Number of px to use as a corner radius. `true` defaults to 8, `false` is 0.

VSpeedDial/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VSpeedDial/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VSpeedDial/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VSpeedDial/id.description: The unique identifier of the component.

VSpeedDial/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VSpeedDial/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VSpeedDial/location.description: Specifies the anchor point for positioning the component, using directional cues to align it either horizontally, vertically, or both..

VSpeedDial/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VSpeedDial/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VSpeedDial/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VSpeedDial/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VSpeedDial/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VSpeedDial/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

VSpeedDial/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`. (Note: The parent element must have position: relative.).

VSpeedDial/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

VSpeedDial/content-props.description: Apply custom properties to the content.

VSpeedDial/opacity.description: Sets the opacity of the scrim element. Only applies if `scrim` is enabled.

VSpeedDial/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of the content element when using the persistent prop.

VSpeedDial/persistent.description: Clicking outside of the element or pressing esc key will not deactivate it.

VSpeedDial/scrim.description: Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

VSpeedDial/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component.

VSpeedDial/target.description: For locationStrategy="connected", specify an element or array of x,y coordinates that the overlay should position itself relative to. This will be the activator element by default.

VSpeedDial/activator-props.description: Apply custom properties to the activator.

VSpeedDial/open-on-click.description: Designates whether menu should open on activator click.

VSpeedDial/open-on-focus.description: Activate the component when the activator is focused.

VSpeedDial/close-on-content-click.description: Designates if menu should close when its content is clicked.

VSpeedDial/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only works with the **open-on-hover** prop.

VSpeedDial/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only works with the **open-on-hover** prop.

VSpeedDial/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VSpeedDial/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator.

VSpeedDial/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VSpeedDial/offset.description: Increases distance from the target. When passed as a pair of numbers, the second value shifts anchor along the side and away from the target.

VSpeedDial/stick-to-target.description: Enables the overlay content to go off-screen when scrolling.

VSpeedDial/viewport-margin.description: Sets custom viewport margin for the overlay content

VSpeedDial/scroll-strategy.description: Strategy used when the component is activate and user scrolls.

VSpeedDial/retain-focus.description: Captures and keeps focus within the content element when using **Tab** and **Shift**+**Tab**. Recommended to be `false` when using external tools that require focus such as TinyMCE or vue-clipboard.

VSpeedDial/disable-initial-focus.description: Deprecated, use `capture-focus` instead. Prevents automatic redirect of first `focusin` event. Intended to use on permanently open menus or VSpeedDial.

VSpeedDial/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element the overlay content should teleport to. Can be a direct element reference, querySelector string, or `true` to disable teleporting. Uses `body` by default.

VSpeedDial/submenu.description: Opens with right arrow and closes on left instead of up/down. Implies `location="end"`. Directions are reversed for RTL.

VStepper/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VStepper/disabled.description: Puts all children components into a disabled state.

VStepper/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VStepper/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

VStepper/multiple.description: Allows one to select multiple items.

VStepper/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VStepper/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VStepper/items.description: An array of strings or objects used for automatically generating children components.

VStepper/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VStepper/location.description: Specifies the component's location. Can combine by using a space separated string.

VStepper/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VStepper/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VStepper/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VStepper/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VStepper/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VStepper/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VStepper/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VStepper/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VStepper/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VStepper/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VStepper/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VStepper/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VStepper/mobile.description: Forces the stepper into a mobile state, removing labels from stepper items.

VStepper/mobile-breakpoint.description: Overrides the display configuration default screen size that the component should be considered in mobile.

VStepper/mandatory.description: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).

VStepper/hide-actions.description: Hide actions bar (prev and next buttons).

VStepper/item-title.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its title.

VStepper/item-value.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its value.

VStepper/item-props.description: Props object that will be applied to each item component. `true` will treat the original object as raw props and pass it directly to the component.

VStepper/alt-labels.description: Places the labels beneath the step.

VStepper/complete-icon.description: Icon to display when step is marked as completed.

VStepper/edit-icon.description: Icon to display when step is editable.

VStepper/error-icon.description: Icon to display when step has an error.

VStepper/non-linear.description: Allow user to jump to any step.

VStepper/prev-text.description: The text used for the Prev button.

VStepper/next-text.description: The text used for the Next button.

VStepperActions/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VStepperActions/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VStepperActions/prev-text.description: The text used for the Prev button.

VStepperActions/next-text.description: The text used for the Next button.

VStepperHeader/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VStepperItem/error.description: Puts the stepper item in a manual error state.

VStepperItem/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VStepperItem/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VStepperItem/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VStepperItem/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VStepperItem/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VStepperItem/icon.description: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component.

VStepperItem/subtitle.description: Specify a subtitle text for the component.

VStepperItem/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VStepperItem/complete-icon.description: Icon to display when step is marked as completed.

VStepperItem/edit-icon.description: Icon to display when step is editable.

VStepperItem/error-icon.description: Icon to display when step has an error.

VStepperVertical/flat.description: Removes the expansion-panel's elevation and borders.

VStepperVertical/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VStepperVertical/disabled.description: Puts all children components into a disabled state.

VStepperVertical/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

VStepperVertical/multiple.description: Allows one to select multiple items.

VStepperVertical/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VStepperVertical/items.description: An array of strings or objects used for automatically generating children components.

VStepperVertical/model-value.description: Controls expanded panel(s). Defaults to an empty array when using **multiple** prop. It is recommended to set unique `value` prop for the panels inside, otherwise index is used instead.

VStepperVertical/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VStepperVertical/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VStepperVertical/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VStepperVertical/readonly.description: Makes the entire expansion panel read only.

VSwitch/type.description: Provides the default type for children selection controls.

VSwitch/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VSwitch/indeterminate.description: Sets an indeterminate state for the switch.

VSwitch/multiple.description: Changes expected model to an array.

VSwitch/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VSwitch/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VSwitch/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VSwitch/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VSwitch/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VSwitch/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSwitch/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VSwitch/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VSwitch/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VSwitch/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VSwitch/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VSwitch/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VSwitch/loading.description: Displays circular progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - primary, secondary, success, info, warning, error) or a Boolean which uses the component color (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VSwitch/inline.description: Puts children inputs into a row.

VSwitch/inset.description: Enlarge the `v-switch` track to encompass the thumb.

VSwitch/direction.description: Changes the direction of the input.

VSwitch/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VSwitch/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VSwitch/glow.description: Makes prepend/append icons full opacity when the input is focused and apply color.

VSwitch/icon-color.description: Sets the color of the prepend/append icons.

VSwitch/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VSwitch/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VSwitch/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VSwitch/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VSwitch/rules.type:
(
  | string
  | boolean
  | PromiseLike<ValidationResult>
  | ((value: any) => string | false | true)
  | ((value: any) => PromiseLike<ValidationResult>)
  | [string, any, string]
)[]
VSwitch/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VSwitch/validate-on.type:
| 'eager'
  | 'lazy'
  | 'blur'
  | 'input'
  | 'submit'
  | 'invalid-input'
  | 'blur lazy'
  | 'input lazy'
  | 'submit lazy'
  | 'invalid-input lazy'
  | 'blur eager'
  | 'input eager'
  | 'submit eager'
  | 'invalid-input eager'
  | 'lazy blur'
  | 'lazy input'
  | 'lazy submit'
  | 'lazy invalid-input'
  | 'eager blur'
  | 'eager input'
  | 'eager submit'
  | 'eager invalid-input'
VSwitch/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

VSwitch/validation-value.description: The value used when applying validation rules.

VSwitch/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

VSwitch/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display.

VSwitch/defaults-target.description: The target component to provide defaults values for.

VSwitch/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VSystemBar/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VSystemBar/name.description: Assign a specific name for layout registration.

VSystemBar/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VSystemBar/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VSystemBar/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSystemBar/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VSystemBar/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VSystemBar/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VSystemBar/order.description: Adjust the order of the component in relation to its registration order.

VSystemBar/window.description: Increases the system bar height to 32px (24px default).

VTab/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [replace](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) prop on the vue-router documentation.

VTab/fixed.description: Forces component to take up all available space up to their maximum width (300px), and centers it.

VTab/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VTab/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VTab/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VTab/size.description: Sets the height and width of the component. Default unit is px. Can also use the following predefined sizes: **x-small**, **small**, **default**, **large**, and **x-large**.

VTab/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VTab/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VTab/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VTab/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VTab/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VTab/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VTab/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VTab/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VTab/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VTab/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VTab/base-color.description: Sets the color of component when not focused.

VTab/prepend-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

VTab/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VTab/readonly.description: Puts the button in a readonly state. Cannot be clicked or navigated to by keyboard.

VTab/stacked.description: Displays the tab as a flex-column.

VTab/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

VTab/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VTab/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VTab/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VTab/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VTab/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VTab/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VTab/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

VTab/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

VTab/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

VTab/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VTab/icon.description: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component. The button will become _round_.

VTab/spaced.description: Extends content to the edges to move main content from prepend and append slots.

VTab/inset.description: Changes the slider to take full height. Automatically propagated from VTabs.

VTab/direction.description: Changes the direction of the tabs. Can be either `horizontal` or `vertical`.

VTab/slider-color.description: Applies specified color to the slider when active on that component - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VTab/slider-transition-duration.description: Applies custom slider transition duration. Default duration depends on transition type (fade: 400, grow: 350, shift: 225).

VTab/hide-slider.description: Hides the active tab slider component (no exit or enter animation).

VTab/slider-transition.description: Changes slider transition to one of the predefined animation presets.

VTable/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VTable/height.description: Use the height prop to set the height of the table.

VTable/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VTable/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VTable/hover.description: Will add a hover effect to a table's row when the mouse is over it.

VTable/striped.description: Applies a background to either **even** or **odd** rows.

VTable/fixed-header.description: Use the fixed-header prop together with the height prop to fix the header to the top of the table.

VTable/fixed-footer.description: Use the fixed-footer prop together with the height prop to fix the footer to the bottom of the table.

VTabs/symbol.description: The [Symbol](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Symbol) used to hook into group functionality for components like [v-btn-toggle](/components/btn-toggle) and [v-bottom-navigation](/components/bottom-navigations/).

VTabs/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VTabs/disabled.description: Puts all children components into a disabled state.

VTabs/height.description: Sets the height of the tabs bar.

VTabs/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

VTabs/multiple.description: Allows one to select multiple items.

VTabs/items.description: The items to display in the component. This can be an array of strings or objects with a property `text`.

VTabs/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VTabs/color.description: Applies specified color to the selected tab - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VTabs/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VTabs/stacked.description: Apply the stacked prop to all children v-tab components.

VTabs/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VTabs/spaced.description: Extends content to the edges to move main content from prepend and append slots.

VTabs/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VTabs/mobile.description: Determines the display mode of the component. If true, the component will be displayed in mobile mode. If false, the component will be displayed in desktop mode. If null, will be based on the current mobile-breakpoint

VTabs/mobile-breakpoint.description: Sets the designated mobile breakpoint for the component.

VTabs/grow.description: Forces tabs to take up all available space.

VTabs/mandatory.description: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).

VTabs/inset.description: Changes the slider to take full height. Tabs will also get some spacing and customizable rounding.

VTabs/content-class.description: Adds classes to the slide group item.

VTabs/direction.description: Changes the direction of the tabs. Can be either `horizontal` or `vertical`.

VTabs/show-arrows.description: Show pagination arrows if the tab items overflow their container. For mobile devices, arrows will only display when using this prop.

VTabs/center-active.description: Forces the selected tab to be centered.

VTabs/scroll-to-active.description: Keeps the last active element visible when resizing the scrollable container.

VTabs/slider-color.description: Changes the background color of an auto-generated `v-tabs-slider`.

VTabs/slider-transition-duration.description: Applies custom slider transition duration. Default duration depends on transition type (fade: 400, grow: 350, shift: 225).

VTabs/slider-transition.description: Changes slider transition to one of the predefined animation presets.

VTabs/align-tabs.description: Aligns the tabs to the `start`, `center`, or `end` of container. Also accepts `title` to align with the `v-toolbar-title` component.

VTabs/fixed-tabs.description: Tabs will be centered and each tab item will grow up to 300px width.

VTabs/inset-padding.description: Sets custom spacing between tabs for `inset` mode.

VTabs/inset-radius.description: Sets custom border radius for the tabs container `inset` mode. Rounding for individual tabs is calculated by subtracting the padding.

VTabsWindow/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VTabsWindow/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VTabsWindow/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VTabsWindow/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VTabsWindow/direction.description: The transition direction when changing windows.

VTabsWindow/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VTabsWindow/transition-duration.description: Overrides transition duration. Does not work in firefox, safari <18, or with `prefers-reduced-motion: reduce`.

VTabsWindowItem/disabled.description: Prevents the item from becoming active when using the "next" and "prev" buttons or the `toggle` method.

VTabsWindowItem/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VTabsWindowItem/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VTabsWindowItem/transition.description: The transition used when the component progressing through items. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VTabsWindowItem/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VTextField/flat.description: Removes elevation (shadow) added to element when using the **solo** or **solo-inverted** props.

VTextField/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VTextField/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VTextField/autocomplete.description: Helps influence browser's suggestions. Special value **suppress** manipulates fields `name` attribute while **off** relies on browser's good will to stop suggesting values. Any other value is passed to the native `autocomplete` on the underlying element.

VTextField/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the input.

VTextField/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VTextField/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VTextField/role.description: The role attribute applied to the input.

VTextField/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VTextField/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VTextField/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VTextField/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VTextField/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input.

VTextField/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VTextField/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VTextField/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VTextField/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the outside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VTextField/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VTextField/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VTextField/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VTextField/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VTextField/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VTextField/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VTextField/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VTextField/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VTextField/glow.description: Makes prepend/append icons full opacity when the field is focused and apply color.

VTextField/icon-color.description: Sets the color of the prepend/append icons.

VTextField/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VTextField/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VTextField/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VTextField/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VTextField/prepend-inner-icon.description: Prepends an icon inside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VTextField/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty.

VTextField/counter-value.description: Function returns the counter display text.

VTextarea/persistent-clear.description: Always show the clearable icon when the input is dirty (By default it only shows on hover).
